definition: to have a sense of shame
to know/to be aware
shame/disgrace
to have no sense of shame
to love learning is akin to knowledge, to study diligently is akin to benevolence, to know shame is akin to courage (Confucius)
pinyin: hao4 xue2 jin4 hu1 zhi1 , li4 xing2 jin4 hu1 ren2 , zhi1 chi3 jin4 hu1 yong3
containing_words.word: 好学近乎知，力行近乎仁，知耻近乎勇

sentences.english: She is making fun of you and trying to embarrass you into trying harder.
sentences.chinese: 她在取笑你并尽力让你知耻而后勇。

sentences.english: How does man head for pride from shame?
sentences.chinese: 人们如何从知耻走向尚荣？

sentences.english: Mike is thick-skinned and never cares what others say.
sentences.chinese: 迈克恬不知耻，从来不在乎别人讲什么。

sentences.english: A holy and shamefaced woman is grace upon grace.
sentences.chinese: 圣洁而知耻的妇女，乃无上的恩赐。

sentences.english: She had brazenly admitted allowing him back into the house.
sentences.chinese: 她恬不知耻地承认了让他回到屋里的事。

definition: honor and shame/sense of honor
to strive for self-improvement
sense of propriety, justice, integrity and honor (i.e. the four social bonds, 四維|四维[si4 wei2])
shame/disgrace
righteousness/justice
disgrace/dishonor/to insult/to bring disgrace or humiliation to/to be indebted to/self-deprecating/Taiwan pr. [ru4]
innate sense of right and wrong/conscience/bosom friend
see a worthy, think to imitate (idiom, from Analects); emulate the virtuous/Follow the example of a virtuous and wise teacher.
to examine oneself/to reflect on one's shortcomings/introspection/self-awareness/self-criticism
to be well-mannered
self-respect/self-love/self-regard/regard for oneself/to cherish one's good name/to take good care of one's health
filial piety and fraternal duty
self-restraint/discipline/selflessness
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)

precepts regarding what is honorable and what is shameful (in particular, refers to the Socialist Concepts on Honors and Disgraces, PRC official moral principles promulgated from 2006)/abbr. for 社會主義榮辱觀|社会主义荣辱观/also known as the Eight Honors and Eight Shames 八榮八恥|八荣八耻[Ba1 Rong2 Ba1 Chi3]
to acknowledge one's faults and correct them (idiom)
